title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 04 December 2015 - XWiki
content:
<Denis3> has joined #xwiki  
07:24 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
08:04 <cjd> has quit  
08:05 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:21 <sdumitriu> has quit

08:36 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
08:41 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki

09:14 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:28 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <tmortagne> guys I can't find how to switch from one language to another in 7.3, for example on http://tuska.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Welcome  
09:33 <tmortagne> it's the standard Welcome page which is supposed to have tons of translations  
09:34 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <tmortagne> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12875  
09:54 <Denis> has quit  
09:59 <vmassol> has quit  
09:59 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki

11:14 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:14 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:37 <sorinello> has quit  
11:49 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki  
11:49 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki

12:24 <Ramona1> has quit  
12:25 <msmeria> has quit  
12:25 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
12:27 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
12:52 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
12:52 <DarkKnightCZ> Hi, is it possible to specify output syntax via groovy when i don't want it parsed by XWiki syntax parser?  
12:53 <DarkKnightCZ> nevermind, outputSyntax=plain  
13:40 <cjd> has quit  
13:52 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
14:24 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
14:28 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
14:33 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
14:56 <sdumitriu> tmortagne: Sorry, just saw the message about PDF and fonts  
14:57 <sdumitriu> With our default FOP files, we only need what's in out package  
14:58 <sdumitriu> s/out/our/  
14:58 <tmortagne> sdumitriu: right now we make FOP load the system fonts (and it seems to be done in a pretty explicit way in the fop-config.xml)  
14:59 <tmortagne> well that explicit just a bad understanding of what <auto-detect/> does actually  
14:59 <tmortagne> it feels like the goal was to load only what is in WEB-INF/fonts/ but we actually ended up loading everything in practice  
15:00 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
15:00 <tmortagne> sdumitriu: so for you we should stop loading anything else than what we embedd ?  
15:00 <sdumitriu> Yes, +1  
15:01 <sdumitriu> Indeed my intention was to only load things in our fonts dir  
15:01 <tmortagne> ok I will create a jira issue about it then and probably bring this up for 8.0, not sure it's a good idea to do it right now  
15:01 <tmortagne> thanks  
15:03 <vmassol> sdumitriu: hi! since you're here, you're missing some doc for issues you closed and this is preventing finalizing the 7.4M1 release, see http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/ReleasePlan74M1  
15:03 <sdumitriu> One thing that may break is embedded SVGs, but I'm not sure  
15:03 <sdumitriu> The rasterizer probably uses its own fonts  
15:03 <vmassol> sdumitriu: do you think you could check this out? shouldn't take long  
15:03 <sdumitriu> Actually forget about the rasterizer, it's not used  
15:04 <tmortagne> sdumitriu: the way I implemented it for FOP 2.0 upgrade is that you can add system font just by putting <auto-detect/> in fop-config.xml so that should be ok I think  
15:04 <tmortagne> i.e. loading system fonts is just more or less configuration  
15:06 <tmortagne> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12877  
15:09 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
15:49 <msmeria> has quit

20:10 <vmassol> has quit  
20:21 <mflorea> has quit  
20:28 <gene> has joined #xwiki  
20:29 <gene> Hi, I was hoping to try out xwiki but it looks like the playground wiki doesn't have editing enabled for registered users? http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Sandbox/TestPage1  
20:29 <gene> Is this intentional or is something wrong with this deployment of Xwiki?  
20:29 <gene> It sounds like it's supposed to be usable : "Click on "Edit" and modify the contents of this page, then click on "Save & View" to see how they look like on your page!"  
20:29 <gene> but with a registered user, there are no edit buttons on the site  
20:30 <gene> This may be a question for vmassol but he doesn't seem to be around  
20:44 <OSIMasson> has quit  
21:01 <sorinello> has quit  
21:09 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki  
21:09 <sorinello> has quit  
21:09 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
21:13 <gene> vmassol: Hey vincent.  I was hoping to try out xwiki but it looks like the playground wiki doesn't have editing enabled for registered users? http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Sandbox/TestPage1  
21:13 <gene> Is this intentional or is something wrong with this deployment of Xwiki?  
21:13 <gene> It sounds like it's supposed to be usable : "Click on "Edit" and modify the contents of this page, then click on "Save & View" to see how they look like on your page!"  
21:13 <gene> but with a registered user, there are no edit buttons on the site  
21:15 <vmassol> gene: you need to be registered on playground  
21:15 <gene> vmassol: indeed, I registered and logged in but dont' see any Edit buttons  
21:15 <vmassol> are you sure you're not registered on the main wiki ie xwiki.org instead?  
21:16 <gene> For example when I go to this page as a registered user ( http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Sandbox/TestPage1 ) there aren't edit buttons  
21:16 <gene> hmm  
21:16 \* gene checks  
21:16 <vmassol> I guess we should allow registred users from xwiki.org to edit too  
21:17 <vmassol> I don't remember why we didn't allow this, there was a reason but I can't remember it right now  
21:17 <vmassol> but I can see in the permissions that you need to be registered locally  
21:17 <gene> vmassol: ya, I registered a user in the playground (username "firstlast") and was logged in. My name "First Last" showed up in the upper right, but no edit buttons  
21:17 <vmassol> ok let me try then  
21:17 <gene> vmassol: I've gone back (and am now logged out). Clicked forgot my password (as I didn't get one in email) but haven't seen one yet  
21:18 <gene> so ya, I was registered in playground (not xwiki.org)  
21:18 <gene> it should be reproducible (register a new user in playground, go to a page to see if there's an edit button)  
21:18 <vmassol> indeed  
21:18 <vmassol> I can reproduce  
21:18 <vmassol> checking permissions more  
21:18 <gene> cool  
21:18 <gene> thanks!  
21:18 \* gene is glad that this isn't intentional and the playground can actually be used to test out edit functionality  
21:19 <vmassol> yeah that would defeat its purpose :)  
21:19 <gene> hehe =)  
21:19 <vmassol> indeed =I can see why,  
21:19 <vmassol> now need to check who changed this!  
21:20 <vmassol> should work now  
21:20 <vmassol> checkinh history  
21:20 <vmassol> \*checking  
21:21 <gene> vmassol: sweet, I can edit now. Thanks so much  
21:23 <vmassol> cool  
21:23 <vmassol> sorry about that  
21:23 <gene> vmassol: no prob  
21:23 <gene> vmassol: if you've got another minute or two  
21:23 <vmassol> hehe :)  
21:24 <gene> vmassol: so you pretty much run xwiki it sounds like  
21:24 <vmassol> not much time but shoot we'll see if it takes long! :)  
21:24 <gene> reading the wikipedia page on the project  
21:24 <gene> vmassol: is wikifarm the revenue model?  
21:24 <vmassol> we're about 10 active devs  
21:24 <gene> meaning how can you afford to develop xwiki  
21:24 <vmassol> and a lot more contributors  
21:24 <gene> ah got it  
21:25 <vmassol> active = daily commits  
21:25 <vmassol> (or close)  
21:25 \* gene nods  
21:25 <vmassol> several of us work for the XWiki SAS company at http://xwiki.com  
21:25 <vmassol> but not everyone, several also work for other companies  
21:25 <vmassol> some do it in the free time without associaiton with a company, etc  
21:25 <gene> and the XWiki SAS company makes money by running hosted xwiki ya?  
21:25 \* gene nods  
21:26 <vmassol> actually if you're interested with the relationship with XWiki SAS:  http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/What+is+the+relationship+between+XWiki+SAS+and+the+XWiki+open+source+project  
21:26 <gene> !  
21:26 <gene> perfect  
21:26 <gene> I'll read that  
21:26 <gene> thanks =)  
21:26 <vmassol> yes XWiki SAS makes money on support, custom development, hosting, training, consulting  
21:26 <gene> cool  
21:27 <vmassol> see http://xwiki.com/en/services/  
21:27 <gene> ya, if my java chops were better I'd head over to the github repo and see if I can bugfix anything but I'm more of a python ruby guy =(  
21:27 <vmassol> no prob  
21:27 <gene> in an attempt to pay it forward/contribute  
21:27 <vmassol> there are plenty of ways to contribute :)  
21:27 <gene> ok, thanks for the context and that link (and for xwiki of course)  
21:27 <vmassol> !search Contributing  
21:27 <vmassol> second link  
21:27 <gene> i'll check that out too. thanks!  
21:27 <vmassol> - http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Contributing  
21:27 <vmassol> :)  
21:29 <gene> neat to read about the xwiki sas model. I work at Mozilla and so the intersection of open source and money is always fascinating to me  
21:29 <vmassol> ah yes nice  
21:30 <vmassol> do you speak French by any chance?  
21:30 <vmassol> (asking since I have a video explaining in details XWiki SAS and xwiki.org)  
21:31 <gene> vmassol: sadly of the people in my team, I'm not one of the two others who speak French =(  
21:31 <vmassol> actually it's linked from the first link I gave you:  http://www.slideshare.net/vmassol/xwiki-sas-an-open-source-company  
21:31 <vmassol> haha  
21:31 <vmassol> np there are other links  
21:31 <vmassol> you still get to see the slides  
21:31 <gene> I have however mastered understanding english with a french accent =)  
21:31 <vmassol> they're in English  
21:31 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
21:31 <vmassol> hehe nice :)  
21:31 <gene> cool, I'll check those out too  
21:32 <vmassol> you'll see the business model and some figures  
21:32 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
21:36 <vmassol> gne   
21:36 <vmassol> oops  
21:36 <vmassol> gene: so that's you https://github.com/gene1wood?tab=activity ? :)  
21:37 <gene> vmassol: yes  
21:37 <vmassol> cool  
21:40 <cjd> has quit  
21:48 <vmassol> bbl
